org.jtrim.access

Class ScheduledAccessToken<IDType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.access.DelegatedAccessToken<IDType>
      • org.jtrim.access.ScheduledAccessToken<IDType>
  • Type Parameters:
    IDType - the type of the access ID (see DelegatedAccessToken.getAccessID())
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessToken<IDType>

    public final class ScheduledAccessToken<IDType>
extends DelegatedAccessToken<IDType>
    Defines an AccessToken that will execute submitted tasks only after a specified set of AccessTokens terminate. To create new instances of this class, call the newToken factory method.

    This class was designed to use when implementing the AccessManager.getScheduledAccess(AccessRequest) method. To implement that method, you must collect all the AccessTokens that conflicts the requested tokens and pass it to this scheduled token. Note that you must also ensure that no other access tokens will be created which conflict with the newly created token.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are completely thread-safe without any further synchronization.

    Synchronization transparency

    Unless documented otherwise the methods of this class are not synchronization transparent but will not wait for asynchronous tasks to complete.
    See Also:
    newToken

    • Method Detail

      • newToken

        public static <IDType> ScheduledAccessToken<IDType> newToken(AccessToken<IDType> token,
                                             java.util.Collection<? extends AccessToken<IDType>> blockingTokens)
        Creates a new scheduled token with the specified conflicting tokens and base token. Tasks will only be submitted to the base token if all the conflicting tokens were terminated.

        The specified conflicting tokens will not be shared with clients of this class, so they cannot be abused.

        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the access ID (see DelegatedAccessToken.getAccessID())
        Parameters:
        token - the token to which tasks submitted to this scheduled token will be submitted to. This token will be shutted down if the created scheduled token was shutted down. This argument cannot be null.
        blockingTokens - the conflicting tokens. Tasks will not be submitted to the base access token until any of these tokens are active (i.e.: not terminated). This argument or its elements cannot be null but can be an empty set of tokens.
        Returns:
        a new scheduled token with the specified conflicting tokens and base token. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments or one of the conflicting tokens are null

      • createExecutor

        public org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutor createExecutor(org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutor executor)
        Creates a TaskExecutor backed by the specified TaskExecutor which will not execute tasks after this AccessToken was released.

        The returned executor is useful to execute tasks which may only be executed if this AccessToken is not released. It is guaranteed, that this AccessToken will not be released while a task submitted to the returned TaskExecutor is currently executing.

        Note that cleanup tasks are always executed, even if this AccessToken has already been released.

        Implementation note: The tasks submitted to the returned executor will also run in the context of the token specified when creating this ScheduledAccessToken.

        Specified by:
        createExecutor in interface AccessToken<IDType>
        Overrides:
        createExecutor in class DelegatedAccessToken<IDType>
        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutor which will actually execute tasks submitted to the returned TaskExecutor. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a TaskExecutor backed by the specified TaskExecutor which will not execute tasks after this AccessToken was released.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this access token in no particular format.

        This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

        Overrides:
        toString in class DelegatedAccessToken<IDType>
        Returns:
        the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
